name: Earth Release: Underground Projection Fish Technique
sourcePage: Earth Release: Underground Projection Fish Technique

raw.wikitext:
{{Infobox/Jutsu |ref=''[[Rin no Sho]]'', page 211 |image=Earth Release Underground Projection Fish Technique.png |kanji=土遁・土中映魚の術 |unnamed jutsu=No |romaji=Doton: Dochū Eigyo no Jutsu |literal english=Earth Release: Underground Projection Fish Technique |english tv=Earth Style: Underground Move Jutsu |game names=Earth Style: Earth Swim Jutsu
Underground Reflecting Fist Jutsu |jutsu rank=C |jutsu classification=Ninjutsu |jutsu type=Earth Release |jutsu class type=Supplementary |users=Kagari, Mahiru, Mubi, Oboro, Kagerō~anime, Mizuki~anime, Muyami~anime |teams=Team Oboro, |debut manga=63 |boruto=No |debut anime=36 |debut shippuden=No |boruto anime=No |game debut=Naruto: Konoha Ninpōchō |jutsu media=Anime, Manga, Game }} This technique allows its user to silently emerge from an earthen surface, moving as a fish does underwater. As or after they've emerged, users are often well-placed to perform assassinations or guerrilla attacks. To help them go unnoticed while they strike, users will often combine this technique with [[clone techniques]]: [[Team Oboro]] uses the [[Haze Clone Technique]], concealing their movements among the mass of clones; [[Mahiru]] uses the [[Shadow Clone Technique]], drawing his targets' attention while another shadow clone sneaks up on them.''Naruto'' chapter 240, page 6 == See Also == * [[Earth Release: Double Suicide Decapitation Technique]] * [[Earth Release: Hiding in Rock Technique]] * [[Earth Release: Hiding Like a Mole Technique]] * [[Earth Release: Subterranean Voyage]] == References == [[es:Elemento Tierra: Jutsu Escondrijo Bajo Tierra]] [[fr:Doton - Projection Souterraine de Poissons]] [[pl:Doton: Dochū Eigyo no Jutsu]] [[pt-br:Liberação de Terra: Técnica da Projeção do Peixe Subterrâneo]]
